str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(originally: a little lamb, but diminutive force was lost), a lamb. Diminutive from aren; a lambkin.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To open. From ana and oigo; to open up.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Seven. A primary number; seven.
Probably strengthened from phrasso; a signet; by implication, the stamp impressed, literally or figuratively.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Four. Or neuter tessara a plural number; four.
An animal, living creature. Neuter of a derivative of zao; a live thing, i.e. An animal.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Neuter Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
Thunder. Akin to bremo; thunder.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To come, go.
